title: QR2 Prof. Kaplan’s Section
text:

Orientation to QR2

Readings:

Rosling Introduction
Note: As a rule, you should have completed a first pass of the day’s readings before the class meets. This being the first day, I can only ask to to try to do this.

Learning about data and statistics

Before-class reading questions as linked above.
Spiegelhalter introduction follow-up reading questions

Discussions:

Sorting out any start-up problems
Spiegelhalter and Rosling readings
In-class orientation to computing

title: QR2 Prof. Kaplan’s Section
text:
Already past
Schedule items will be moved here (in reverse chronological order) as an archive.

title: QR2 Winter 2025
text:
Under construction



To instructors: This is a draft of a shared homepage for QR2.

It lives in the QR2-W25 repository on Github.
The URL for students is https://qr2-w25.github.io/homepage/.
The link to paste into RStudio to clone the repo on your laptop is https://github.com/QR2-W25/homepage.git

title: QR2 Winter 2025
text:
Day-by-day schedule
There are six class sections for QR2. These follow a similar schedule, but naturally the viscisitudes and opportunities of classroom discussion lead to variation on a section-by-section basis. Accordingly, you should bookmark your section in your browser for easy access to the most up-to-date information.

Section 1 (Prof. Ruth)
Section 2 (Prof. Overbey)
Section 3 (Prof. Kolpakov)
Section 4 (Prof. Kaplan)
Section 5 (Prof. Puelz)
Section 6 (?)







In draft



The above list of sections is tentative. We should update it to reflect the actual section naming policy.
Depending on your preferences, you might want to replace your link(s) to point to another system, for example Google Sheets.
Danny has implemented a sketch of a schedule page in Quarto. Other instructors can draw on that as an example if they like. Each schedule should be placed in the QMD file with the indicated name. If you are using a different scheme for managing day-to-day class information, you may simply want to link to that in your QMD file. A throw-away example is in TBD-schedule.qmd.

title: QR2 Winter 2025
text:
General information






In draft



We can replace this with links to the Populi system, if that’s more appropriate than what DTK has drafted here.


Textbooks:

David Spiegelhalter, The Art of Statistics: Learning from Data
Hans Rossling, Factfulness
QR 2 Computing Tutorials online

Policies:

title: Reading Questions
text:
Each of the six blocks in QR2 has assigned readings from Spiegelhalter, Rossling, and the computing tutorials. There are corresponding reading questions. These are organized by book chapter. Your instructor will indicate which questions are due and when.
Some of the reading questions should be completed and submitted before the date scheduled for the classroom discussion. Others are intended as follow up after the discussion. Due dates for the follow-up questions will be specified by individual instructors.
Note that some documents may be empty.
